page.title: 07CUSTOMS.
page.content: On July 3rd. 1985 the annual Dedication took place in the grounds of Roos C.E. Primary School.The amusements were a bouncing castle,bean-bag game,a tombola,a raffle,flower stall,teas,ice-cream and a fruit and vegetable stall.There were also pony rides on the school field. The service beforehand was crowded with people.Four boys read out the Cub Scout Law and Promise.The Bishop blessed the school.Mrs.Hildyard made a speech and opened the fete. Roos Show began about 42 years ago.It was originally held in a big marquee Behind the Institute.Now it is held in Burton Pidsea Village Hall.Classes include:flower arranging,cookery and children's classes.They hold Spring and Summer shows.Fox hunting also takes place in Roos and Tunstall.
